item.description:
You and your friends play as one of six heroes and navigate an ever changing dungeon. Triumph over encounters to earn treasure or test your luck with Quests to earn Epic Treasure! Find the key to unlock the boss door, and prepare yourselves for an epic battle against one of six unique creatures of darkness.

Dungeon Runners is a board game designed to introduce new players to table top fantasy games without being too overwhelming, but while still maintaining a fun experience for hobbyist players. There are 3 different play lengths, a short game, mid game, or long game. The board is modular, so each run will be unique each time you play.

Single Player: For a single player campaign, the player takes control of 2 heroes.

—description from the designer

name.value: DRAGUT: The sack of Rapallo July 4th 1549

item.description:
Dragut is a two players game recreating the sack of the Ligurian city of Rapallo on July 4th 1549.

On that day, at dawn, a fleet of several galleys at the orders of the famed Ottoman pirate Dragut arrived at the shores of this sleepy harbour; the pirates beached in three areas (Porta delle Saline, Imbarcadero and Nagge, all depicted on the map) and started the sack; no resistance was encountered, as no garrison nor alarm drills have been organised by the city council, despite the Genoese Senate had advised of pirate activities in the area.

The only brave act was performed by Bartolomeo Maggiocco, a local boy who saved its sweetheart, Giulia Giudice, struggling the pirate at the Porta delle Saline. The only escape way was fleeing to the hills and several citizens made it, and more others were captured by the pirates and put in slavery in Berberia.

Will you manage to avoid the sack of the city and save its inhabitants?

Or will you sack the city and gain reputation among the Pirates?

The game consists of 24 colourful units to be cut and glued, 18 nice cards, a gourgeous map to be printed on A3 folio and the English rules.

—description from the publisher

In order to enter the race each player has to throw a 6, then he places his 'cycle' or counter, on to 'Start'.
Whenever a 6 is thrown the player is entitled to another throw.
At the end of the game the exact number required to bring the cycle to 90 must be thrown. If, for instance, a cycle is at 89 the player must throw a 1 to be 'home'; if he throws a 6 he must use up the other five in going backwards, and will therefore be on 85.

Teddy Tail was a comic character that first appeared in 1915 as a comic strip in the Daily Mail newspaper.

Field of Mars was originally intended to function as a 'battle board' for the Lace Wars series, which is 'operational' in scope and normally resolves battles using a combat results table. To add value to the product, Field of Mars has been designed to function as a complete game in its own right, suitable for playing both random and historical battles devised by the players. No knowledge of the Lace Wars rules is required. (Caveat: the game does not include any historical scenarios.) With some modification it could also be used to play battles generated by different game systems.

The game uses a gridded mat and terrain tiles to create a wide variety of battlefields. The players' forces are deployed on this mat in stacks of counters called 'wings'; the wings are the 'manoeuvre unit' in this system. The players issue orders to their wings by rolling dice and distributing them among their wings. The more pips a die has showing, the greater the number of tactical choices its wing has. Once orders have been issued, a series of discrete steps is followed, each permitting the execution of one particular kind of action (for example: Advance, Fire, Assault). In each step the players decide whether any eligible wings (those with the correct die value) will execute that action. The object of the game is to render opposing wings hors de combat. In the context of the game this means the wing is removed from play. This is accomplished through artillery and musket fire, cavalry charges, and infantry assaults. The first side to go over the required number of hors de combat wings loses the battle.

The rules include instructions for creating random battles using the counters provided and also instructions on how to use the game to fight battles generated within the Lace Wars system.

Components
1) One large play mat, called the Battlefield.
2) 360 die cut counters representing various generic forces, plus markers. Scale is variable.
3) 60 terrain tiles
4) Rules, charts, and tables.

name.value: 1975: A Card Game for 2 About the Cold War

item.description:
Do you remember the seventies of the previous century? In those days, world politics were a simple thing. There were two superpowers, who lurked at each other in deep distrust and emphasized their ideological contrasts, and a third one, who stood aside with no emotions.

Nevertheless, World War III was never a real option. But both the USA and the USSR were always keen to harm each other in the Third World, and to drag every dingle despot to the "right" side. Both giants wanted to have governments of their favor everywhere in charge as long as possible -- in order to draw out as much as possible of there wealth of all these countries...

In this two-player card game, players use a set of action cards to win control and influence in countries around the world. Yellow "China Chips" play a special neutralizing role. The aim is to win the most money by winning the sympathies of the other countries.

This game was self published by Franz Benno-Delonge years before Twilight Struggle. When Twilight Struggle appeared with such immense (and deserved) support, Benno-Delonge produced a few more copies of 1975 for those interested in another approach at this interesting time period in world politics.

—user summary

Honestly? is a bluffing game. Players win by lying to friends about whether or not they are actually a liar.

Each player is dealt a single card stating whether or not they are a liar. Clockwise, they state if they are a liar or not, of course not having to tell the truth. After the statement, the next player either states "I believe you" or "I have concerns".

If concerns are expressed, the active player has 10 seconds to make their case that they are telling the truth. Then the accusing player must either respond with "I believe you" or "honestly?"

If the accusing player says "honestly?" then the active player must reveal their card. If the active player was telling the truth, the accusing player is eliminated from the game. If the active player was lying, they are eliminated.

Play continues until all players have been the active player or until only one player remains. If all players have been active and multiple players are in the game at the end of the round, then all players must reveal their cards. If any player(s) successfully lied, they win. If no players lied about their cards, everyone loses.

Ultra-Quick College Hoops features over 1800 teams from the 2017-2018 college basketball season. All Men's teams belonging to the National Collegiate Athletic Association (NCAA) Divisions 1, 2 and 3, the National Association of Intercollegiate Athletics (NAIA), the National Christian Collegiate Athletic Association (NCCAA), the United States Collegiate Athletic Association (USCAA), the Canadian Interuniversity Sport league (CIS), the Canadian Collegiate Athletic Association (CCAA), the Association of Christian College Athletics (ACCA), and Men's Independent Teams. The 2018 Women's Division I teams are also rated. No other game comes even remotely close to rating as many teams!

The 2018 Edition features our exclusive Strength of Schedule system. You can match any team from any division, and get realistic results. We also include the brackets for all of the tournaments!

Ultra-Quick College Hoops allows you to easily complete a tournament or team schedule in one sitting, without sacrificing realism. Included in each year book are the tournament brackets for every division that has drawn at press time.

All of the teams have their TEMPO reflected in both OFF and DEF ratings. This makes the final scores in line with real life scoring.

Ultra Quick College Hoops is the complete package for the college basketball fan. You can replay all tournaments, or even every game played in the 2017-18 season. The only limits are your time and imagination. (This description fits generically for most seasons).
